cui_name: Microcephalic primordial dwarfism due to ZNF335 deficiency
reasoning: Microcephalic primordial dwarfism caused by ZNF335 deficiency is an extremely rare autosomal recessive disorder. Characterized by severe growth deficiency from birth with head circumference >9 standard deviations below normal. Typically fatal by age 1-2 years. Very few cases reported globally, estimated <0.01 per 100k births.
source: Orphanet rare disease database and NIH Genetic Testing Registry
